00001 /**
00002  * \file Random.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for Random, RandomGenerator.
00004  *
00005  * This loads up the header for RandomCanonical, RandomEngine, etc., to
00006  * provide access to random integers of various sizes, random reals with
00007  * various precisions, a random probability, etc.
00008  *
00009  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00010  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00011  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00012  **********************************************************************/
00013

00020 #if defined(_MSC_VER)

00028 // Suppress "defined but not used" warnings
00029 #define RCSID_DECL(x) namespace                     \
00030 { char VAR_ ## x [] __attribute__((unused)) = x; }
00031 #else
00032 /**
00033  * Insertion of RCS Id strings into the object file.
00034  **********************************************************************/

00036 #endif

00038 /**
00039  * Use table, Power2::power2, for pow2?  This isn't necessary with g++ 4.0
00040  * because calls to std::pow are optimized.  g++ 4.1 seems to have lost this
00041  * capability though!  And it's back in g++ 4.4.  So, for simplicity, assume
00042  * that all "current" versions of g++ perform the optimization.
00043  **********************************************************************/
00044 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE)
00045 #if defined(__GNUC__)
00046 #define RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE 0
00047 #else
00048 // otherwise use a lookup table
00049 #define RANDOMLIB_POWERTABLE 1
00050 #endif
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #if !HAVE_LONG_DOUBLE || defined(_MSC_VER)
00054 #define RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC 53
00055 #elif defined(__sparc)
00056 #define RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC 113
00057 #else
00058 /**
00059  * The precision of long doubles, used for sizing Power2::power2.  64 on
00060  * Linux/Intel, 106 on MaxOS/PowerPC
00061  **********************************************************************/
00062 #define RANDOMLIB_LONGDOUBLEPREC __LDBL_MANT_DIG__
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 /**
00066  * A compile-time assert.  Use C++0X static_assert, if available.
00067  **********************************************************************/
00068 #if !defined(STATIC_ASSERT)
00069 #  if defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
00070 #    define STATIC_ASSERT static_assert
00071 #  elif defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1600
00072 #    define STATIC_ASSERT static_assert
00073 #  else
00074 #    define STATIC_ASSERT(cond,reason) \
00075             { enum{ STATIC_ASSERT_ENUM = 1/int(cond) }; }
00076 #  endif
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Are denormalized reals of type RealType supported?
00081  **********************************************************************/
00082 #define RANDOMLIB_HASDENORM(RealType) 1

00096 /**
00097  * \brief Namespace for %RandomLib
00098  *
00099  * All of %RandomLib is defined within the RandomLib namespace.  In addtiion
00100  * all the header files are included via %RandomLib/filename.  This minimizes
00101  * the likelihood of conflicts with other packages.
00102  **********************************************************************/
00103 namespace RandomLib {
00104 
00105   /**
00106    * \brief Exception handling for %RandomLib
00107    *
00108    * A class to handle exceptions.  It's derived from std::runtime_error so it
00109    * can be caught by the usual catch clauses.
00110    **********************************************************************/
00111   class RandomErr : public std::runtime_error {
00112   public:
00113 
00114     /**
00115      * Constructor
00116      *
00117      * @param[in] msg a string message, which is accessible in the catch
00118      *   clause, via what().
00119      **********************************************************************/
00120     RandomErr(const std::string& msg) : std::runtime_error(msg) {}
00121   };
00122 
00123 } // namespace RandomLib
00124 
00125 #include <RandomLib/RandomCanonical.hpp>
00126 
00127 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_BUILDING_LIBRARY)
00128 
00129 namespace RandomLib {
00130 
00131 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_DEFAULT_GENERATOR)
00132 #define RANDOMLIB_DEFAULT_GENERATOR SRandomGenerator32
00133 #endif
00134 
00135   /**
00136    * Point Random to one of a specific MT19937 generators.
00137    **********************************************************************/
00138   typedef RANDOMLIB_DEFAULT_GENERATOR RandomGenerator;
00139 
00140   /**
00141    * Hook Random to RandomGenerator
00142    **********************************************************************/
00143   typedef RandomCanonical<RandomGenerator> Random;
00144 } // namespace RandomLib
00145 
00146 #endif  // !defined(RANDOMLIB_BUILDING_LIBRARY)
